author: {'steamid': '76561198011093206', 'num_games_owned': 729, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 13, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1711793784}
review:
Good luck on getting this game to run decently on modern systems.

- Lacks support for modern resolutions. Softlocks if you try.
- Lags and stutter alot when you do get to play the game.
- Cutscenes are too fast, skipping parts of the dialogues.
- Random unpredictable crashes.
- If you have two monitors, the game defaults to secondary monitor.
- You have to set the compatibility mode to "Windows 98" on the launcher file (BLOOD2.EXE). Otherwise, the display settings on the launcher will work when it feels it wants to.
- Default control settings are messed up. No primary attack, no jumping and no crouching. You have to fix this manually ingame.

This is what I've experienced when trying to play this game on my Windows 10 pc. So I can't recommend Blood 2 to anybody, at least not the Steam nor GOG releases of this.
Then again, Blood 2 was a buggy mess at it's original release (see Civvie 11's playthrough of it), but at least you could run and play it on PC:s during the 98 era.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046208795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1708821784}
review:
Playing Blood 2 after Half-life, Sin and Quake 2 is utterly bizarre as it feels like a megamix of all of the above. It tries to improve on the monumental original by making the enemies down the line more crisp instead of the slushy ones on the later chapters of Blood but besides this, it keeps using the same maps with variations (like the subway) to get more gameplay out of it. Although the tension keeps it from getting boring it sure gets repetitive sometimes. halfway into the game, it does have it‚Äôs moments, like the return of the hand now giving you the finger‚Ä¶

After 200 bugs, breaks and bad dialogue Gideon finally takes you to hell, by now things should be getting interesting but I'm too exhausted to even tell...Oh wait, they ran out of time and budget so there is only one short level and if you think the expansion pack will help with that think again, it's only four short broken levels...Pray the devil that this sequel hasn't killed the franchise for good!

review:
Well, it has its moments but you definitely can feel its development had been rushed: Monolith developed LithTech engine, Shogo MAD and Blood 2 at the same time. And it shows in both games. While Shogo MAD felt slightly better, Blood 2 feels okay only in first chapter. Then you play same stuff again. Cheap gamedev trickery.
My problem with the game was AI being almost an aimbot (just like in Shogo MAD) - as soon as you get in contact with bots you get shot.
Add to that trying to start the game on modern systems which makes game totally not worth it. Shogo MAD at least had robots and anime vibes.
Hope both games will get proper remake some day

author: {'steamid': '76561197986971249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1698672166}
review:
I don't know why it says I only have 98 minutes played, I've got at least 10 hours in.
This game is a major pain to get running, I managed to get it going on my old computer 9 years ago, and that was a pain in the ass to do. Now it seems most tutorials are either out of date, or may or may not work at all depending on your luck.

This game is honestly no where near as good as the original anyways, and honestly it isn't even worth the hoops you have to jump through to play it, if you even can. It's a very out of place sequel, going from dark gothic horror 1930s settings, to a more goofy sci-fi futuristic setting that completely missed the mark on what made the first great. The Expansion brings it closer to the first game, but if you do manage to get it running, you'll likely finish the expansion in an hour or 2.

Until the day Nightdive hopefully does something with this game, do not bother. Just play the original with all its fantastic user content, like Death Wish, and Bloody Pulp Fiction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339401910', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 275, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1676832718}
review:
Great old school FPS game, similar a bit to Quake and Duke Nukem 3D. Environment is destructable, almost every item can be destroyed. The game itself is of course very bloody, has nice locations, interesting enemies and awesome dark atmosphere, occult-themed. It's pretty long and so freaking HARD - even on medium difficulty.
The game has many technical problems with modern hardware configurations and new operating systems, but yet they released it on steam without fix (damn you Atari).
However, it's nothing you can't fix yourself by replacing some files.
Definitely worth playing :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198225908660', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1667671779}
review:
My review of Blood 2: The Chosen

To begin, Blood 2 is a continuation of the heavily criticized and ridiculed build engine predecessor called Blood or as it is somewhat known today, Blood: Fresh Supply, thanks to the "remaster" from Nightdive Studios. The game starts off with the player character, Caleb, on a subway train, being chased by a cabal of cultists looking to kill him. This is a pristine example of how to do an intro to a game right, the subway train level being one of the peaks and later being reintroduced for its brilliant design. The assortment of weapons at Caleb's disposal are also top notch, with classics such as the howitzer, giving the player extensive freedom in how they deal with every situation. As for the story, I won't spoil it for anyone who wasn't yet played this masterpiece, but trust me when I say this, the story will keep you on your toes and engaged all the way. 

In conclusion, Blood 2: The Chosen is a masterpiece that more people should try out at least once for a once in a lifetime experience. Tune in next time for my next review on Daikatana! üòÑ

author: {'steamid': '76561198012890721', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1673193669}
review:
First of all, I'm a big fan of Blood. It was my very first game and it will always have a special place in my heart. 

I always knew Blood II was out there, but I have never played it until now. I was so afraid I won't like it. And actually I was right. Maybe it's nostalgia towards the first game, but I didn't like new enemies, new soundtrack and I pushed the game till the end only to hear Stephen Weyte's voice as Caleb. This is the only thing that's great about this game. Main antihero voice. 

I can't recommend Blood II. Not to mention it runs poorly on new system and requires some fixes to get it running (it's still crashes very often, but loading takes seconds so I can forgive that). The worst thing in my opinion was the ambience. Second game doesn't have the ambience of the first one.

Weapons are no longer satisfying, sawed off shotgun is being reloaded too slow, tesla cannon is just ugly and tommy gun was swapped with some uzi-like machine pistol. Also no pitchfork but knife instead. 

Second thing is the soundtrack. I already forgot what the music was, and I'm fresh after completing the game and the addon. It's just not as good as the one from first Blood. 

The best part of it all was the short Caleb's story in Nightmare addon, where we had a chance to shoot some cultists. I missed them a lot.

It's a good old school shooter, but it's not Blood anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988509925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1672726549}
review:
First and foremost lets get it out of the way, this game is not going to run properly on a modern machine unless you actually want to put in the work to cap it close to 60 frames per second, use someone elses arcane hackery, "Yes I am filtering you peeps out, run it offloaded into Lutris (Or whatever else your nerdy brains can finagle 'you may have those'.) So you can get all the jankville goodness in its full splendid 16:9 glory  'proportions to fit' with no audio snipped in the cutscenes." Now that that is out of the way and I have been down for the craic, lets open for business.

This game is the business and unless you have been hiding under decades of rocks you are going to hate this, pause... No you are going to hate this, you see I have a strange overwhelming habit of liking obscure trash the likes of which your average garden variety granny won't put up with. No she just won't have it, she just won't, she has the shingles and you see Mr. Caleeb probably gave her those and the crabs, I mean bone leeches. 

Oh and by the way this game has one of the most killer soundtracks for a gothic style video game in existence, it's absolutely diabolical sounding. The sick freaks that put this first person kit together get my thumps up.

This is not a fine wine, this is battery acid that somehow worked its way into a mysterious flaw at the bottom of a bottle, bonded with a few trace contaminant compounds, started a chain reaction and ate through the glass. Yes it's that chaffing and will make your nuts itch. 

I remember back in the day when this game came out, and I went dirty spastic gremlin sphincter all over it. Now that I have it setup and fully functional it's even better than I remembered, which isn't saying much but God I love it, even when it crashes, cause it
loads up so fast it doesn't even matter.  

It's brutal and will one shot you in the most cruelest and unpredictable of ways.

So to sum it up if you know what you are getting yourself into, it's cheap you know? It's a beautiful janky half baked awful awful masterpiece and none of you are going to change my opinion otherwise. No, I have not played Daikatana but I can tell you from watching Civvie 11 videos that this is better by several magnitudes of singularities. The game is outrageously 
unfair, so if you absolutely must do yourself a favor and pick the genocide difficulty first cause this is the most ridiculously hard first person shooter on the planet.

review: A deviously fitting sequel to the classic FPS game "Blood", it has hilariously dark (yet sometimes cheesy, in a good way) one liners and tons of blood and gore, plus some of the most twisted enemy designs from this era of PC games. It's as much of a blast to play as watching a good {bad) action flick from the 90's. I highly recommend it to any fans of horror, FPS games, demon lore, HP Lovecraft, and good (bad) action flicks! Go drain yourself some BLOOD too! I know I enjoyed mine!

author: {'steamid': '76561198161754648', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1676703426}
review:
This is one of the worst, or maybe even the worst game I have ever played.

Pretty much everything is broken in it, from constant crashes, broken game difficulty balance, ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• sounds, settings/controls not saving or saving but being removed for no reason later, to constant stuttering (despite game showing stable 60 fps) or totally broken damage mechanics. 1 time u one shot enemy with a headshot, but after reloading the save file and fighting with same enemy, same gun, same difficulty level, u need to unload 50 bullets in his head. On Suecidal difficulty, if u fight like this with a hitscan enemy, it means that he will in return take away like 1/3, 1/2 half of your hp - from full.

On top of that controls are total trash, u have 2 options - fight with constant negative acceleration with mouse smoothing on, or turn off mouse smoothing, and set mouse input to raw, which results in sensitivity jumping around all the time. Even during one 360 degree turn around ur sens will go from very high to very low unpredictably.

Massive amount of other bugs, enemies walking in air, getting stuck on environment for no reason, damage/bullets shot by enemies go through walls etc.

I would maybe, maybe, name it beta version - this is if I manage to finish it without any unskippable blocker. For now I am in chapter 2 and I have already enough of this game. Will finish it just to get it ticked as such on my list, but if u haven't started yet - do not buy it even if it is for 1 USD.

Mind that above opinion is made after playing the game properly prepared - which means spending like 2 hours on setting up all patches, fixes etc that I was able to come across and that were recommended by people. I do not even want to think in what state this game was released, without all those fixes.

Publisher who made decision to sell a game product in such shape, should be facing some legal accusations.

review:
Blood 2 √® un FPS vecchia scuola, probabilmente non all'altezza del primo capitolo ma comunque in grado di regalare qualche ora di divertimento.
Il gioco √® pieno di citazioni, frasi sconclusionate e chicche di vario tipo.
Rispetto ai giochi moderni in Blood non vi viene detto niente, tant'√® che alcune volte sar√† difficile anche trovare la strada per proseguire; non vi viene suggerito in alcun modo come risolvere gli enigmi (enigmi, oddio: leve da tirare e pulsanti da schiacciare per poter liberare la strada dagli ostacoli). Alcuni livelli sono dei veri e propri labirinti tipici degli FPS di quegli anni. 
La vita ovviamente non si rigenera da sola ma va raccolto l'apposito item, stessa cosa per munizioni e scudo.

Io l'ho comprato a due spicci perch√© avevo conservato un ricordo discreto di quando lo giocai circa 1000 anni fa.
Su windows 11 gira abbastanza bene anche se sporadicamente riscontro dei cali di frame piuttosto evidenti ma che non impediscono di proseguire nel gioco.

Se vi piacciono gli FPS di una volta ve lo consiglio caldamente (soprattutto se in sconto) mentre se siete abituati a giocare solo giochi recenti dove tutto √® semplificato, suggerito, imboccato, allora lasciate perdere.

the music is amazing in it and the gameplay isn't really "that bad" sure its comical at times but still im having fun with it.

but yeah the games unbalanced and broken.

review:
***BEAR IN MIND - you will most likely need to do some modding to get this game to run on Windows 10+***

This was a real blast from the past to play!  I always love revisiting an old '90s FPS like Blood II to have a good nostalgia rush and get frustrated by obtuse level design XD.  Definitely worth the struggle to get running, this game is a real treat, and a bit of a cult classic nowadays.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021129489', 'num_games_owned': 968, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1641234907}
review:
I'm going to start by saying - play this game or atleast find a playthrough to learn what rushed development due to unreasonable deadlines can do with game that had so much potential, after being sequel to one of the best shooters of old days. No blame is to be put on Monolith, as they likely did the best they can to have this game run in at least this state.

Now to actual review - game is bad. Like really bad. I could find many good things about Daikatana when I played it a few years back, but this... this is just sad. 
Game relies on like 3 patches to run it on win10. It crashes a lot (even on old PCs). AI is dumb. Story is a nonexistant mess. Playable characters are unballanced and while they lead to new experience, most of those experiences are bad. Bugs everywhere. Progression sucks at times. Enemies are sponges on both medium and hard difficulties. Explosions that kill you through walls. Keys that blend into environments. Repeatable environments. I don't even want to go on anymore.
A few good things - game looks alright for 98, at least in my opinion. Stephan Weyte is still great as Caleb. Some guns are cool, I guess. Also expansion has better level designs than main game.
I had my fun with game, because I knew it is going to be bad, and I encountered many funny as heck bugs, had fun on stream, but if I just wanted that game to play on my own, have a good time - that likely won't be as such.

Play at your own risk - 3/10 (I just don't want to give it 2 and expansion was quite fun in terms of stages, atleast in my opinion, so I bumped it a bit, but it is still really low 3)

author: {'steamid': '76561198184282673', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1639692547}
review:
Initially, I thought that Blood 2 was just an unfortunate sequel that came out sometime in 2000's and was lazily made by a different studio ‚Äì a story similar to Deus Ex and its Invisible War sequel. However, when I saw the actual release date and googled the whole story behind the game's development, I felt really bad for the developers and even didn't want to critisize Blood 2 harshly. Nevertheless, the problem is that at the end of the day those tragic events do not improve the quality of the final product from the player's point of view.

For those who don‚Äôt know, in short, the publisher of Blood was close to bankruptcy and they demanded Monolith Productions to make a sequel "here and now". And you already can guess the rest: the game quality turned out to be very mediocre and GT Interactive was bought by Atari anyway. Now I could start writing a long review with detailed analysis of every game's aspect, however, I won't do it. Not only because I personally feel bad for the developers but because just the idea of making a full-fledged 3D game with sufficient plot and unique features in 11 months back in 1997 sounds ridiculous enough by itself. From that point of view, I'm surprised that Blood 2 came out as a playable-ish product and not just a laggy-buggy piece of code. However, as I've already stated, the development story doesn't justify the game's quality for the consumer, so I will just give you a list of problems the game has. Let's go!

Mostly cramped linear levels 
Instant-reacting hitscan enemies
Weird animations 
Totally unbalanced difficulties 
Odd drops from destroying objects
Censored swearing
OP facejumpers in the water  
Clumsy transition between levels
Flare gun looks like shotgun
Repetitive voice lines from enemies 
Voodoo doll happy particles
Stupid AI
Weird hitboxes
No sniper aiming animation
Knife has a bullet-hitting sound
Locked and decorative doors look the same
No convenient way to bind weapons
Enemy damage goes through walls
Mouse wheel does not work
The game crashes regularly 
Explosive weapons have insanely low damage
Idiotic damage RNG
Character speed breaks in the nightmares add-on
Initially, it seems fine but the father you go the more miserable it becomes

And I could easily finish my review at this point, but the game actually had decent ideas, like 4 playable characters, semi-open world and detailed plot. Some of them even made it to the final game: there are about 20 weapons you can find and use, magic weapons have regenerating ammo, Life Leech heals you, each character has different stats and plays a bit differently. However, those few good ideas just drown in the sea of bugs, poor level design, unbalanced AI, etc. 

Should you play this game? Well, if you liked the first title and just want to know what Blood 2 is ‚Äì maybe. If you are looking for a good retro shooter ‚Äì no. If you like to explore unfinished and quirky games ‚Äì probably. My only recommendation will be to play it on the lowest difficulty ‚Äì genocide. Do not waste your nerves and time with the higher ones, it isn't worth it at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198805845261', 'num_games_owned': 4041, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1667149751}
review:
[i]Blood 2: The Chosen came out back in 1998 as a rushed to market, broken mess of a game. Following up on a legendary build-engine FPS classic in a world where non sprite based 3D engines were just hitting the market, it was only natural that Blood would follow suit. You play as Caleb or one of the other Chosen. Still fighting The Cabal, who have now gone from being a simple cult in the first game, to a fullblown global corporation.[/i]

[b]Facts[/b]
[list]
[*] One of the earlier 3D engine FPS games.
[*] The campaign consists of four chapters divided into 30+ levels.
[*] Contains The Nightmare Levels, adding an extra chapter.
[*] Lots of mindless violence and gore throughout.
[*] Rushed to market.
[/list]
[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*] Caleb is a bad ass.
[*] Stephen Weyte again does a fantastic job on voice acting.
[*] The first chapter is actually decent.
[*] Some of the weapons are great.
[*] The pop culture referencing humor is still there.
[*] The graphics carry that late 90's, early 00's charm.
[*] Nightmare Levels bring back some of the creativity from Blood. 
[/list]
[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*] The game is riddled with bugs and prone to crashing.
[*] Only Caleb's campaign has a semblance of story.
[*] Lots of backtracking in later chapters.
[*] Boss battles are often bugged and not fun to play.
[*] Trial and error gameplay because of hitscan enemies.
[*] Random spawning enemies cause severe frustration.
[*] Gideon is a terrible antagonist.
[/list]

[b]Recommended?[/b]

No. Stay away from this game. Good luck getting it to run at all, and then good luck getting a satisfying gameplay experience. The first game is infinitely better, this one killed the franchise and is best forgotten about.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066545552', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1610409575}
review:
[h1]I recommend this game only in retrospective, based solely on the question "What if?"[/h1]

What if Atari didn't mess with the production (by releasing the game way too early)? What if Monolith had the time to finish and refine it? Blood II: The Chosen shows its potential subtly, and it's very sad how even this embryonal blueprint is unplayable (despite how many patches and fixes you'll apply, there's always a glitch or two, a crash, or both. Not to mention several gameplay issues).

If you're a die-hard fan of Caleb the badass, undead gunslinger, maybe you won't mind trying to fix it and experience at least part of it, however, stay miles away if you don't know what you're getting into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198850914175', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1621029765}
review: Boy oh boy,what a mess this game is,and im the type that usually enjoy games most people don't(Duke nukem forever for example).Where do i start.First lets get the pros out of the way.The actual feel of the guns and sheer variety is great,and the death animations,and the way enemys scream or moan in agony makes gunplay satisfying.The game looks good for the time it came out,and although its definitely dated now the graphics don't take away from the experience. Nowww lets talk about the main thing that kills the fun of this game.THE INSANE UNBALANCED DIFFICULTY!Did they seriously even play test this game before they released it???? This game might just have the worst balance of difficulty in a game i ever saw.Theres 3 difficultys genocide,homicide,and suicide.Genocide is the easy mode of the game,but the issue with this difficulty is its wayyyy to easy.Its so easy it feels like your playing with a cheat that makes enemies do little to no damage while you obliterate them in 1 or 2 shots.This difficulty makes playing COD on recruit look like normal difficulty in comparison(yeah its THAT easy).Homicide is the supposedly "normal" mode of this game but instead feels like very hard mode.Enemys are absolute bullet sponges,and due to their terminator like hitscan accuracy AND high damage they can kill you very easily,and to make it worse,the game does not give you enough health to get past certain points which makes alot of gunfights trial and error kinda things.Suicide is suppose to be hard,and to be honest due to how insanely difficult homicide is i haven't even tried it,and get headaches just imagining how impossible it is to beat it on suicide.This game also has annoying bugs such as enemys getting stuck through the floor but still able to shoot you,doors you are suppose to go through,but all of a sudden becoming invisible walls which causes you to either load your last save or start the WHOLE LEVEL OVER!!I could look over the laughably bad voice actiing(Calebs voice acting is awesome tho),uninspired level design,and cringe humor,but i simply CANNOT look over how unbalanced the difficulty is in this game(even with the extra crispy mod it has some issues) which is why i cannot recommend this game to anyone (also i played this about 3 hours more then what my time says).Its ashame because this game had potential but the rushed unpolished programming killed the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079187939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1658914362}
review:
Eens je de game aan de praat krijgt is deze Blood 2 een fantastische game met een prachtig leveldesign, mooie 1998 (Quake 2-style) graphics, heel veel gore en zwarte humor!
De levels wisselen elkaar voortreffelijk af en de wapens zijn erg leuk om te gebruiken.
Groot minpunt is wel dat uit het water geraken soms erg vervelend kan zijn, zeker als er facehugger fishes op de loer liggen ! Deze nasties kan je vergelijken met de hand uit de vorige schitterende game.
Ook zijn er wat clipping issues maar voor velen is het de Kunstmatige Intelligentie of beter het totale ontbreken van. De vijanden staan er maar bij te staan klaar om afgeschoten te worden zoals op de kermis !
Met de geluidseffecten, het commentaar van Caleb en de muziek zijn erg goed.

Echt een aanrader voor iedereen die het niet erg vind in de oude LithTech engine (vergelijkbaar met Quake 2) te gamen. Nostalgie en een gory knalfestijn ten top !!!

PS: kijk naar de guides hoe je je problemen kan oplossen !

Shipping unfinished by a publisher who was bought by infogrames who now masquerades as atari by wearing its severed face, the game will never be finished. author: {'steamid': '76561197996859750', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 396, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1605364243}
review:
Look, I played and beat this game. You need to download some fixes in order for it to play right in current OS. Even if you manage to run it, it has lots of bugs, glitches and crashes, and the difficulty levels are all over the place. But I liked it.

At their time, I didn't really like much this early 3D FPS games. But I'm rediscovering them now, and enjoying them as a product of their time. It doesn't get anything near to how EXCELLENT the first Blood was, so you may be kind of disappointed comparing it to the first one. I'm finding some kind of charm in this classic, fast paced, brutal FPS with low poly graphics.

I can only recommend it if you are really, REALLY into old FPS, and if you don't care about dealing with patches, fixes, bugs, glitches, and overall bad game design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028769894', 'num_games_owned': 1844, 'num_reviews': 267, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1567803215}
review:
I don't know whether I should or should not recommend it.

It's an alright little game, I suggest you play a demo to see if you like it, the weird atmosphere, selection of weapons, parts of level design, are pretty good, however - when it comes to gameplay, any higher difficulties are horribly not fun to play.

Let me just warn you that this game is absolutely full of hitscan enemies, the game can be a breeze for you still, but if you use a single or few savestates, you might get f***ed.
The pickups are not evenly spread out, and the fact that you have to tank some of that hitscan damage to proceed, you might be at sections where it's either almost impossible, or just not fun to force yourself through. One that I encountered that tipped the scale was the bossfight before hopping on an airplane. Depending on how well you managed your health and ammo during the fight, you may have an easy time on next level, or you will s**t bricks, desperately reloading to take as little damage as possible. It's a fundamental flaw that made me press NO on recommendation at first.

If you take away the difficulty, you're left with a breezy walk, but through a pretty nicely put together game.  The game visually looks alright, has some nice surroundings, weapon and enemy designs. The main character is kinda "wannabe badass", but at least his visual design is weird and pretty "cool".
The game does however have a few low points, sewer levels, bad bossfights, and infuriating facehugger enemies, that to this day I don't know how to get rid of.

The setting is a mix between dirty suburban places, that don't feel quite right (in a good eerie way), and vampire, demon influences. The buildings and streets are not only filled with mercenaries, but also zombies, weird eldritch monsters, insectoids, walking and jumping hands, and flying vampires.
I feel like the game is due for a solid remake, the base is pretty damn good and unique. The concept art for some of the main characters highlits it I believe.

Music is either minimal, or it's a nice bopper in the main menu. Could be a bit more out there at places I feel, it's "dynamic" so it uses parts and mixes them up during gameplay, it's setting the mood ok, but I feel like it could do better at that.

The plot is ok, it could be powdered up, as the foundation works better, than the stiff dialogues in cutscenes in game. You play the same Caleb as in first game, trying to resurrect a chosen 3, and assume the position of power. Probably the most awkward thing is exposition on loading screen (not just trivia), since computers got much faster (especially with SSD), you can barely read anything on them.

Overall it's very memorable, but rough as hell. maybe a decent, non-crashing, good looking, and easier to follow version will be made someday, given that even games like XIII seem to be getting remakes recently.

review:
Before I begin this review I feel as though I must ask, what exactly is a Blood 2? Well for me it was a buggy unfinished fuck fest that resulted in me wanting to end my life. This game has the most technical problems I have ever seen in a video game, enemies stuck on terrain, crashes texture issues and a bug that crashes the game if you increase the resolution. Not only that, but I also had to install a fan made patch just to get the damn thing to run. The weapons are all very unsatisfing to use, mainly because of the fact that the game has this wonky ass rng damage thing going on, so you never know if your bullets will tickle an enemy or one shot them. The only thing I did like was the Music and voice acting/story. It is overall a fairly ok continuation of the blood story with some cool moments thrown in. 
If you want a solid experiance out of this game I recommend that you try the extra crispy mod, It greatly improves weapons, gets rid of rng damage and fixes many technical problems.

Overall I give this game a 1/5 FUCKING RAW

author: {'steamid': '76561198071357475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 393, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1588029943}
review:
AVISO: el juego dura mucho mas de lo que dice steam porque ya lo termine, y no se porque no registro el tiempo de juego. 

BRILLANTE!!!!!! hacia tiempo que no disfrutaba tan bien un shoter de la vieja escuela. En su momento me habia parecido espectacular la primera entrega que la jugue por primera vez en 2012 porque recien para esa epoca hicieron una actualizacion para windows xp. Luego lo habia jugado este al tiempo pero no me convencia la jugabilidad porque no la entendia mucho. Ahora que lo encontre de vuelta en steam decidi darle otra oportunidad. Con mucha desconfianza ya que no poseia buena rese√±as y padecia de bugs severos. Pero por fortuna encontre en el foro un parche no oficial para poder correrlo bien en windows 10 y nunca he estado mas contento por haberlo terminado ahora. Por fin termine de jugar la saga blood y a mucha honrra ya que el terror como genero me encanta y tambien los shoter gore un combo explosivo.

Antes de seguir tengo que avisarles de que hay un bug con una puerta que no se puede abrir en las oficinas de cabal co Asi que no se averguensen de usar el truco de traspasar las paredes. Porque sino es imposible pasar el nivel. 

La historia me ha parecido fantastica. Yo lo jugue en ingles asi que se requiere tener uno basico para entender mas o menos la historia. Despues de derrotar a villano del juego anterior y despues de absorver su alma Caleb el protagonista vago por la tierra en compa√±ia de personas en ambientes de mala muerte, durante 100 a√±os. Y poco a poco la cabala tomo muchisima influencia a lo largo de los a√±os hasta convertirse en una importante corporacion multinacional que abarca muchisimos productos. Y su lider quiere capturarlo para hacerse con el poder del poderoso demonio en el cuerpo de caleb. A su vez aparecen numerosas criaturas de otra dimension consecuencia del gran poder en el interior de caleb que desestabiliza ambas realidades. La campa√±a tiene muy buen ritmo y vale mucho la pena jugarla.

Las mecanicas son basicamente como las de cualquier shoter de la bieja escuela. Matar todo lo que se mueve, interpretar el ambiente, encontrar la llave, pasar al siguiente nivel y repite el ciclo. Aca si no esperes que la partida se guarde cada 5 minutos, no esperes que la vida se regenere sola cuando te cubris, no esperes mundo abierto ni mejoras de armas y habilidades. En esta epoca se jugaba de esa manera. jugabilidad simple, agil, campa√±a lineal, accion directa, pura y dura. Sin vueltas. Si esta clase de juegos te aburre, segui de largo. Porque es un juego de 1998. 

El apartado artistico es lo que mas me ha fascinado. Quiza los entornos no sean tan diabolicos y grotescos como el primer juego, pero aun asi con las limitaciones de la epoca le da un muy buen acabado. Me ha fascinado muchisimo el dise√±o de las criaturas. Un amplio y variado lore de diferentes seres de otra dimension y bien grotescos. Me ha gustado tambien la evolucion historica de la cabala. Pasando de ser fanticos religiosos armados a equipos comando muy bien armados y entrenados.

El sonido me ha gustado mucho tambien. Es cierto que es muy monotono pero le da una ambietacion espectacular a la campa√±a. Por momentos la musica recuerda un poco a la de nine inche nails. Me ha gustado mucho los efectos de sonido como los disparos, Le agrega aun mas frenetismo al gore y a la accion. Y por momentos te genera una inmersion tremennda. Tambien los rugidos de cada criatura. Como si en su idioma tubieran una entoncacion distinta por cada especie. ajajajaja. 
 
Sin palabras estoy sumamente contento de haber terminado la secuela de uno de mis juegos favoritos. Si el primer blood te gusto este ultimo te va a encantar. TOTALMENTE RECOMENDABLE!!!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020093779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1694300501}
review: For nostalgia sake alone is this game worth it, the soundtrack amongst other 'good' things also makes it worth the replay. There are a majority who call this game an absolute turd due to rushed production because of 'corporate pressure' over passionate development. It was unfinished and lacked much of what made the original a gem in the name of good old fashioned horror games. However we should all know a common lesson about 90's sequels for those of us old enough to remember that decade, that lesson is 'nothing is ever as good as the original' the sequels are the rushed and thoughtless successors of their formers who had more charm and soul where the sequel becomes the bastardized cash grab. This unfortunate practice echoed into films, television and games throughout the 00's where corporate greed overwhelmed serious art and passionate imagination. Blood 2 however existed in a time when the corporate greed hadn't yet killed Monolith as they rolled out successes like F.E.A.R. and Condemned before their corporate slaver forced them to make commercially friendly stuff ignoring their history whilst adding more sex and less soul to it. If you are one of those retroists who want to relive the good old days when things walked their own road and not a big wig dictated one, play this.

review:
What can I say. It's so raw it can still talk, fly and give relationship advice. Feels so rushed.

Getting it to work properly is bothersome but quick if you have a guide. Still crashes rarely. Gameplay not as bad (but not very good either) as the balance. Airplane level has barely any ways of healing so you gunna abuse the AI... Gore is way unrealistic. I wouldn't recommend playing this game on any other difficulty but 'Genocide' unless you're a hardcore Blood fan like me. It will only make a normal player disappointed and uninterested, but at least a Blood fan it will make us remember and appreciate the first game more. 

That being said, it still has content value, definitely. So much potential. Play on genocide, don't take it seriously and you should have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976176572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 1267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1661059913}
review:
If you can get this game to work, you can enjoy one of the most lackluster sequels to one of the best classic shooters of all time!
[Pro-Tips: Set the game to 'Run as Administrator' & 'Win98 Compatibility Mode']

'Blood 2: The Chosen' takes place over 100 years in the future from the original, and the Tchernobog Cabal still thrives, now as a global megacorporate superpower -- CabalCo. -- under the auspices of a zealot named Gideon.  
Our protagonist, the undead gunfighter, Caleb, takes the fight up the corporate ladder to their leader -- reviving his old band of Chosen killers from their eternal slumber as he goes.  You can play the game as any of the characters, who all possess different abilities and stats, but only Caleb's playthrough has cutscenes.

Sad that this port didn't get any TLC from Atari -- the title would be fun to blast through for a lark with appropriate playability upgrades..
If you have nostalgia for it, you know what there is to enjoy, otherwise, it's kind of crappy and half-baked.

The franchise storyline is available here:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2397531551

author: {'steamid': '76561198160207272', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1553526433}
review: At first I liked Blood II. First levels are certainly the best ones. Then you see repetitions and lack of good game design. You notice that your weapons feel awful, and some are useless (your rocket launcher is damages opponents worse than a shotgun), that enemies are either bullet sponges, or not a threat, you realize that sometimes it's better not to fight at all, just sprint around to the exit. Bosses are boring, challenges are either unfair (like with hitscanners that are obnoxious, or huge monsters that shoot rockets at you while you're in a corridor, and the splash damage can get around corners), plot is laughable, art design is just meh. Add constant bugs like getting killed by closing doors (yeah, you will be afraid of doors after that), unskippable cutscenes... And the list goes on. It's a bad game, and it always was one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052636113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1593569010}
review:
Dissapointing and poorly tested. Blood I was tons of fun, and this 3D game is exasperating in difficulty. Weapon damage is poorly calibrated. Even cannons or plasma launchers won't make too much damage while some enemies can receive a ridiculous amount. A hit with the plasma balls, blackholes and cannon shells are equivalent to a shot with 2 shotguns. Some enemies that can grab you to death and there is no way to get free from their grip will appear hidden in corners to guarantee they catch you. Weapons from enemies make a LOT of damage to you...

Leaving aside that you need the VgVoodoo card emulator to play on Win 7 and beyond, the game itself is a collection of bad practices. Only entertaining if you play in God mode (cheatcode MPGOD). Not a worthy sucessor. I remembered it bad, but playing it now made it worse.

Enemy animations are nice. Some scenarios look good. But that's it. You are always low on ammo because most enemies are like mammoths

4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198043782587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 598, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1550709249}
review:
I expected game to be deeply flawed but have a potential. To have fun levels but bad balancing. After all, it has at least some positive reviews and some that love it, albeit it has to do with playing it with childhood.
But alas, it seems that all that a game is required to get "not so bad, check it out" nowadays is not to crash on startup and be somewhat old. Looking at you, ten thousand retro reviewers on YouTube.

Because boy, this one has no potential. It's a drab, bland, worthless waste of time. And no, I am not going to include things like "that one weapon looks fancy" because it's just crumbs and bits over one plain wood disguised as a pie. I mean, there are pretty much no levels that were worth playing. Gone all the fancy gothic and inspired mazes. Now we have completely bland and uninspired places like subway. And subway again. Bland. Endlessly bland sewers with no soul. There is only one spot where game more or less remembers that it's supposed to have inspirations, apartment where it references The Shining and boy, it sticks out like a sore thumb compared to everything else.
Even gore sucks and has no feels. Neither do controls and physics this time.

Sure there are many bland shooters that don't try to be anything more than grey corridors but it's supposed to be a sequel to one of the more creative non-realistic ones. BOO!

It also tries to have plot but it's just trash and rash as it doesn't care. Not even enough to make it entertaining, it's just confusing mess of who cares and who CARES.

And that's not mentioning the balancing. Boy. It either does stupid-hitscan dumb sentries that disguise as enemy humans or just BSy monsters. The former, yea, the AI in this game is so dumb that they overcompensate that with reaction, accuaricy and damage. When you fight humans, which you will do a lot, you don't feel like you fight humans, it doesn't feel tactic. You just feel that you got into poison gas zone and you have to just shoot the source of it real fast while losing HP anyway. And yea, I heard that Easy difficulty is too easy and Normal is too hard, so good luck. It doesn't even provide health powerups as much because killing enemies may spawn one. But it's randomized and has a low chance so good luck with having a good time. And monsters are just bulletsponges, often placed in tight corridors while controls of this game suck unlike Blood 1. At some point I realized that it's better to just run past every monster. Less of waste of time and effort and ammo.

I mean, how come this true-3D game somehow has worse explosions than "dat fake 3D" Build engine original... Because here the splash damage of explosions passes through level geometry. Who thought it's okay?! What a devolution.

Bosses suck too. Final boss should be seen to be believed of how awful designed it is. The only tactic of which is to sit behind rock and shoot booooollets at that FAT. It's like they forgot that player is supposed to be intellectually challenged (even if it's for a spine brain and small-time tactics of avoiding things) and thus have fun.

The only thing I liked is how infighting is handled between monsters and human enemies that fight each other as soon as they see each other. Unlike other 90s shooters they don't decide that you are priority number 1 for the rest of their life just because you shot a single bullet when these two groups are present, they kinda prioritise on who is too dangerously closer.

Overall, Blood 2 The Chosen is a complete waste of my time and I hate it. After beating it there was nothing that I could say was worth playing.

Okay, almost, it includes The Nightmares addon. Playing it was like getting a bucked of cold icey water over my burning soul of hate (yep, because I value my time). It actually had creativity and soul put into it. An inspiration. Levels with great ideas going behind them, where each of the four heroes tell their little tale in various locations. Sadly, it's still flawed balance-wise and it's way too short. But at least it's something after an awful base game.

And yea, you can make the game run properly. Just use a fancy Steam community guide that has high-resolution patches and dgVoodoo2 wrapper.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002551061', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1613531033}
review:
(mini-review).

The graphics are attrocious.  The cut scenes are laughable.  And yet, as a nostalgia piece from the late 1990s, Blood II: The Chosen is a stark example of everything that's missing in today's shooter landscape.  Originally released by Monolith in 1998, complete with singleplayer, multiplayer and a fleshed-out DLC, Blood 2 had a gory and brutal campaign, even by today's lax standards.  The game follows the protagonist: Caleb, an immortal native american half-breed who possesses the powers of Chernobog, a dark godlike entity that was disposed of during the first game of the series.  You're opposed this time, by Chernobog's greatest disciple: Gideon, who now has a megacorporation at his beck and call.  Unlike other shooters, every individual and entity within this game is a psychotic monster that preys on the witless chattle of the world.  You replenish your health by consuming the hearts of your enemies and even the heroes are cold, narcissistic animals.  With grungy, dark music, a twisted world possessed by genetic freak shows and evil spirits and akimbo shooting play, Blood 2 was an impossibly dark yet compelling shooter that represented what was best about the frenetic end of the millennium gaming landscape.  

Only one question remains... "How do you like your flesh cooked?"

Recommended.
8.5/10.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TMRdxJUSQ8E&index=5&list=PLA62E484F1149383C

author: {'steamid': '76561198414350299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1582706692}
review:
ok reasonable game with mild to average storyline. The weapons are a lot of fun and thus far into chapter 2 i have found roughly 13 or so weapons. The weapons are pretty fun however if you chose to dual weild some of the lesser weapns it seems you can no longer use secondary fire modes which is lame. The enemies i have found so far break into about 9 different types give or take with varying skills and abilities. The thing about the enemies that annoys me however is they are a bit op even on easy, the weapons used by the enemies within the game so long as they arent bullet based (eg handguns, uzi, assault rifle) can even affect you behind solid cover. So this means you have to get out of range entirely as the blast radius goes through solid walls. Map layout is enjoyable with more than a few interesting and gory features although i dont really understand why there is a use button as it seems almost all the interaction is automatic except for doors. The early maps in chapter one are frustrating as certain features that would make solving issues such as where to go are blurry due to average graphics. Now i know this was made in the 90's but its predecessor using a lesser graphics setting could convey it clearly. the game is fun across the board although it still has a few programing errors such as
-spawning errors where characters spawn near the roof
-sudden shutdown of game
-occasional random lagging with multiple character spawning that continues throughout session
-game freeze that basically cuts you off from using your computer(had to restart computer as the game wouldnt let task manager be displayed)
-doors killing you in cutscenes

author: {'steamid': '76561198129936651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 477, 'playtime_forever': 1361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1318, 'last_played': 1520203989}
review:
Blood II: The Chosen + Expansion is such a disappointment of a game, but let‚Äôs tell the story.

The year is 2028 and Caleb the man from the first game has spent the last century since killing the dread demon Tchernobog in trying to bring back his comrades, the Chosen, who were killed by the evil god. 

But even with the evil Tchernobog dead the Cabal, the ones who used to worship him are still around. Since there master‚Äôs death at the hands of Caleb, the Cabal has turned their cult into a global mega-corporation called CabalCo in hopes to restore Tchernobog and destroy Caleb.

But not if Caleb has a say in it, now Caleb must fight the Cabal and there leader Gideon but there is something even worse than the Cabal that is coming, but can Caleb stop this new evil ?

All right now what is good about this game, well the updated Graphics where cool. Now to me I don‚Äôt really care about that, but it was a nice update from the first game.

And like with the first game the levels were well made and gives us some unique place‚Äôs to see. But not as much as the first game. The new weapons we got were fun to use. 

But the best in the game were all the easter eggs/nods to some movies and the first game and some other stuff.

All right now for the bad. The game crashes a lot you can still play it but even if you turn the graphics all the way down it still crashes, some people have said that it is because it‚Äôs an older game and call bull-crap on that.

Why well the first game is just as old and to me it did not have a crashing problem like this game hell some other old games I have played did not have a crashing problem like this, I mean they did have their bugs but not like this. 

You can still play this game, but the crashes are really annoying. Then there are the bosses some of them are very frustrating to fight the worst ones being the Cathedral boss, the final boss and the final boss in the Nightmare level.

They have attacks you can‚Äôt doge like the Cathedral boss‚Äôs laser attack or the final boss‚Äôs laser attack. Or the homing attack by the final boss in the Nightmare level.

And there attacks can be way over powered were in just a few seconds your dead. Hell some of the enemies can feel that way too. Then there is the A.I it‚Äôs just really pathetic and sometimes buggy like one enemy just being/hovering on top head. 

And there is the new enemy the bone leeches just like with the hand enemy that chokes you to death these guys darn your life. 

But why are they bad you may ask? Well the choking hand enemies are in this game; I mean why have these bone leeches in this game when you still keep the choking hand enemies from the first game and they both do the same thing.

Last thing the story leave‚Äôs a good bit unanswered. [spoiler] like how did the three chosen come back to life? There were all killed in the first how are back? And then there Gabriel who was a man then becomes a girl called Gabriella and they don‚Äôt say how. 

Then there this doctor that works for Gideon and we don‚Äôt know jack all about him other than he is an evil doctor. [/spoiler]

So with all that said this game is really a disappointment it had a lot of potential but bugs the bosses the A‚ÄôI and some of the Story really just sucked. So I can‚Äôt really recommend this game even if you are a fan of the first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098563486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 1393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1519943968}
review:
Blood 2 is a very interesting game. It's very flawed, broken and it was cleary rushed but it's still fun to play and has a fare number of things working for it despite being a doomed production from the start

Pros
Most of the weapons are fun to use
It has a huge arsenol of weapons
Even though the expansion pack is short it's still fun and included for free plus considering the default price is $4.99 I'd say this is forgivable in this version of the game
Now the Lithtech enginge may not look the pretiest but it has wonderful gore effects if it moves it'll blow up into bits of flesh and blood
It's cool to have extra playable charectors with advantages/disadvantages 
Just like the last game this one is filled with refferences to horror and pop culture one of my favorites would be the "got blood" billboard
The level descriptions/objectives have a lovely sense of humor
The soundtracks awesome
You can hear Calobs magical voice anytime you want with the tap of a button

Cons
Now you can dualwield weapons as long as you want but then their alternate fire modes don't work which does suck but this is realy only a big deal for the flare gun and sawed-off shotgun
I couldn't get the remote detonated bombs to work
This game is buggy there were a few instances were an invisible wall kept me from progressing but these moments were rare
This game can be way to dark either you can see or it's pitchblack and the flashlight is almost uselesss and the night vission goggles were completly useless 
It's cool how this game has plenty of secrets to find but the level design is generaly linear combine that with how dark it can get and you may feel discouraged to explore
The difficulty modes are kindof broken Genocide is super easy Homicide can be pretty hard and Suicide is well ludicris the biggest problem is that none of these come off as a Normal mode its either too easy or to hard
This game does crash on rare ocasions but it still happens 

Despite its many flaws I can honnestly still reccomend this game its a mess but it's still fun to shoot goons and monsters as Calob with Lithtech gore effects

review:
Put simply, this game's sale price, one or two weapons and about 2 or 3 levels are its only saving grace. If you can get it to run at all, of course. I'm not the type of person that gives a thumbs down for nothing, so I'll delve a little deeper.

Before I go on, a word of warning: this game is wildly unstable and hard to get up-and-running properly. This is also one of the main reasons I gave it a thumbs down, it's just too damn unstable, even with all the patches, fixes and running it at 1366x768 if you have a 16:9 monitor, it's the only resolution that looks good and runs relatively well, anything above 1000px in height crashes every third quickload.

But let's say you got it to run, so what are you getting? As far as presentation goes, it's dated, but not entirely garbage. The weapon models are done alright, the character models not so much, but the enemies some of the environments are what stood out to me. The sound design is also pretty good, music is minimal but effective in helping the visuals set a really dark/gloomy atmosphere, the weapons sound really good too. The problem is, they only sound good.

The weapons in this game, while cool on paper, are the most puny, unimpactful pieces of trash I've ever seen in an FPS game, which is a shame, because in the original Blood, the enemies were tough, but the guns packed a punch hard enough to balance it out. Here, the vast majority of enemies take A LOT of ammo to kill. For example, there are these bug-like creatures that take 70 assault rifle rounds to kill. EACH. Granted, you can carry 500 rounds, but what the hell does that help if there's 3 of them along with some other (even tougher) enemy types, that maybe take 100 assault rifle rounds and 20 Tesla charges to kill? The Tesla cannon is the only weapon with some semblance of punch, but ammo for it is scarce. The Napalm launcher has been neutered to the point of insignificance. It simply kils nothing. Weak. I don't know if this is a problem with the actual weapon damage or the enemy hitboxes, but the bottom line is that the way the guns and enemies work together SUCKS. The only cool weapon is the Hook thing you get in the Nightmare levels, which spawns portals that shoot out chained hooks that pull the enemy towards said portal; if you spawn enough of them, the sorry sack of meat to end up in its grasp will literally by ripped apart slowly. Cool stuff. Why not more of that and less generic, bulletchomping crud?

I think the main problem with this game is simply that it's artificially difficult to the point of ridiculousness; unfair, cheap, and most importantly, not fun, 80% of the time. I'm not new to 90s FPS games (in fact, if you have a quick look at my library, you'll see that it's pretty much the bulk of what I play) and I completed the first Blood, but this game is just... frustrating. Most enemies are (as mentioned) bullet sponges, hit-scanning enemies have an accuracy so high that two of them will get you from 200HP to 34HP in a matter of seconds, hard-hitting projectile enemies are often spawned in small areas with no way to dodge the projectiles or even the splash damage, ammo is distributed poorly, health even more so, the boss battles suck (especially the Nightmare boss) etc. It doesn't click, most of the time is what I'm saying.

I could go on and on about this but let me just use the Behemoth enemy type as an example. It's the boss of chapter two. I had to empty 100 sniper bullets and the ENTIRETY of my Tesla cannon to defeat it. In chapter 3, it's a fairly common enemy type, and it's not even one bit weaker, not to mention the game often spawns two at a time. Sure, they infight with other enemies, but you're still wasting massive resources to defeat an enemy which ultimately doesn't even need defeating because you can just run past it. In general, the balance of resources vs. enemies that good FPS titles like DOOM, Quake, Shadow Warrior, Duke Nukem, the first Blood etc. got down to a tee is completely absent here. I literally speedran/skipped upwards of 2/3 of a level because I just couldn't be bothered to stand there and pump hundreds and hundreds of rounds into these tenacious wastes of disk space. Let me illustrate the situation: in the penultimate level, the game spawns three of these large, tough and powerful Lich-like enemies into a narrow-ish corridor. They fire napalm-like fireballs with huge splash damage and you have nowhere to dodge. Hm, should i just... run past and avoid them completely or use up all my hard-earned ammo so that I'm left ammo-less for the sure-to-follow boss encounter?

There is a forgettable and rushed story in there somewhere, but the voice acting is bad (even Caleb's voice actor, who is excellent, has some downright cringy moments), the villain is an annoying, pompous tw4t, the Chosen are about the least memorable crew I can think of. The expansion is less than two hours and has the most lazy writing I've seen in a while and the most annoying boss in the entire game (who the hell makes a boss that shoots undodgeable homing projectiles?). The only way I could beat it without cheats is to literally get it stuck in the world geometry and hold LMB until the thing dropped and I had the intense satisfaction of listening to Gideon's disgusting voice narrate the end of this nightmare.

That's not to say this game is ALL bad. It has a vibe that really hadn't been done before and honestly hasn't been done since. The controls are great and smooth, as they should be for a 90s FPS, the levels are non-linear and the architecture is, for the most part, well designed (even though some levels like the subway train or Cabalco offices are lazily re-used up to THREE times), and in terms of actual good gameplay; what about the other 20 or so percent that ARE fun? Well, the gore system and gibbing in this game is immensely satisfying, when everything clicks, it's pure 90s FPS mayhem as it should be, but this is sadly so rare that I can just barely state these moments exist.

All-in-all, unless you're a die-hard Monolith fan (which I can't blame you, they made much better things than this disappointment) or you find the prospect of bulletsponge enemies and frequent crashing fun, I'm having a hard time recommending this game, even if it does cost 1.5‚Ç¨ during sales. If it ran properly, I'd probably give it a "barely recommend" and just caution everyone to be aware of it's questionable design and cheapness, but since it's also a buggy mess, I just can't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987175590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 1104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1104, 'last_played': 1501000423}
review:
[h1]!!Important note!![/h1]

I am running windows 7 on my computer and let me tell you, this game crashes a lot.  People have even said that they can't get this game running on a windows 10 computer.  Just be aware of this if you consider buying the game.   


[u]What I liked about the game[/u] 
[list]
[*]	The game still has that sense of humour the first game had.

[*]	You can play has four different characters, although I would of liked to of seen the characters abilities when choosing. 

[*]	Awesome boss fights, especially the last one.

[*]	Some of the weapons were good; like the singularity gun, minigun, and napalm gun. 

[*]	Some of the levels were alright like the human slaughter house and the campus from the expansion pack, but still they had so much more potential.

[*]	Alright soundtrack. 

[*]	It has some little things that I liked from the first game; like being able to kick severed head and being able to restore your health using people's hearts.

[*]  Plenty of gore and dismemberment    

[u]What I disliked or was disappointed with[/u]

[*]	Boring levels; which is a shame because the first game had some really memorable levels like; Dark Carnival and Phantom express. Some of the levels I felt were a great idea, but they could of been done better; for example when you stubble into a human slaughter house and the school campus from the expansion pack. 

[*]	Some ugly looking weapons; like the pistol, assault rifle, and flare gun. They have also replaced the pitchfork with a boring looking knife. The weapons don't have much of a kick compared to the first game; I was very disappointed with the explosives, because they weren't as effective as they were in the first game.  

[*]	Too many nuisance enemies (hand, leech, and spider). 

[*]	 No cleverly hidden secrets; I remember in the first game you could interact with a piano and a secret hatch would open. I felt the game needed more references to horror films. 

[*]	You can't interact with things (except levers and doors). I remember in the first game you could interact with the mirror and Caleb would say something. 
[*]	Enemies aren't particularly interesting, although the undead monks from the first game make a comeback in the expansion pack, which is pretty cool. Some parts of the levels you will find yourself just running through them, because the later enemies are just bullet sponges and deal a ton of damage; you do it to save ammo. 

[*]	The A.I of the civilians is just terrible. 

[*]	Playing the game on normal, is like playing it on hard.          
[/list]
[u]Conclusion[/u]  

Very disappointing; the game feels rushed. Not a patch on the first game, even the games expansion isn't as good as the expansions from the first game; like Cryptic passage or plasma pak. If I were you I would give this game a miss or wait till the game is heavily discounted; it's not worth the hassle. So much potential and so much wasted. After playing Shadow Warrior (2013), wolfenstein new order, and Doom (2016), I think now would be the perfect time to do a remake or a new game for the blood series; Plezzzzzzz. 

[h1]4/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198012461973', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1202515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59493, 'last_played': 1676704739}
review:
This is a bad game compared to the first Blood, which is a masterpiece. I like some of their ideas (for example seeing the city at night from the elevator in Chapter 1, and the feeling of being a fugitive walking in dark alleyways between buildings during the night, hearing police sirens, that sort of thing), but the execution was bad. This one has many faults, for example you can glitch through boxes, sounds are awful (weapon sounds, Caleb burn sound, the cultist saying Pestis Cruento in the Cathedral sounds like he's retarded etc), the choking hands were replaced (not entirely, they are still present but introducing the Bone Leech was not needed) (you meet them again in C2L9) with HL-like headcrabs called the Bone Leech (they even introduced vortigaunt-like monsters called Shikari), AI is stupid (you can just run past them if you want and if you're at 0HP they will ignore you until you use a healthpack, also if one of them is in the way while you're being shot at they will hit and kill each other), weapons feel so weak (if you want easy kills, preemptive shooting FTW in this game). Everything that was good, no more. 
One thing that I must praise is the soundtrack though (look for Blood II: The Chosen OST - Ancient One Combat II on YouTube and tell me: isn't that awesome?). Then there's also the visual effects: when you shoot flare guns on enemies on a dark corridor and everything lights up red - that looks awesome (test it in C3L3: Temple of Poon when you get upstairs).
Also, elevators that go down to water? Enemies with crowbars? It's clear that they tried to copy Half-Life, and perhaps a few others as well, like Realms of the Haunting (Shikari looks and sounds so much like monsters from ROTH), Doom (keycards, seriously? Skull, dagger, etc keys were iconic in Blood; the flloating chasing heads are also copy-pasted from Doom) and Quake. Come to think of it, even the train areas look like that Duke Nukem 3D level (Metro Mayhem), but that may be a bit stretched (Caleb saying Groovy also reminds me of DN3D).. (maybe even Postal; especially the Nightmare loading screens) Do I need to continue?
However, what I liked was the Nightmare expansion levels (praised be the level designers), they are a nice throwback to the original maps, particularly C5L1 and C5L3, which resemble the original E2M3 (and E2M9 at the beginning) and E1M4, respectively. I absolutely love the Nightmare levels. Revisiting the ice mountains was so cool. C5L4 is E2M5. Also Ophelia in C5L2... (even the Cathedral in the main game resembles E1M6 The Great Temple from Blood 1, and part of Chapter 2 resembles E3M3: Raw Sewage. C2L3's bridge resembles the bridge and area from Blood's E1M6. Climbing on boxes in C2L4 reminded me of Blood 1's E2M2: The Lumber Mill), and the same level (C2L4) in the Processing Plant area also reminded me (because of the oven that you can go through and the 3 temperature readers nearby) of E1M1 and E1M3's ending (maybe even E3M5), and going through the red meat remains reminded me of E3M2 and perhaps some other original levels as well. Next up is C2L5 (this level gets the award for crashiest level), I like that they built a wrong way to go on the train tracks, reminescent of E1M2. C2L6 (I had to restart it because all the switches were already triggered therefore it was bugged) reminds me of E1M6, and maybe its water areas remind me a little bit of the dam reservoir/water areas from E3M6. I think C2L9 is meant to represent E2M8 at night, but it doesn't have the same feeling. C3L3: Temple of Poon is somewhat reminescent of E1M6 at first, that's probably the paintings and corridors, then becomes clear it's E1M6 with a strong hint of E2M7 - Bowels of the Earth. C3L4: Cabalco Enterprises looks like E3M4: The Sick Ward (closest), E4M9: Mall of the Dead or E2M4 The Overlooked Hotel's interior. C3L5: Power Station reminds me of E3M6's grey corridors. C4L1 is obviously meant to remind us of the Shial fight in E2M8; after the fight, during the chaos, it might resemble E4M5..
Still, not enough Blood 1 references and B1 style "secrets": no cracks in the walls to blow it up with TNT (replaced by fire extinguishers now)? No cash register secrets in shops? No creepy paintings that keep changing into evil faces? No creepy statues that move their eyes depending on where you are (I know why that happened in the first game, but it could've been done here as well). No scary ghosts (phantasms) (they could've worked perfectly in C3L7 instead of patients)? No bookcase secrets? No gargoyles disguised as statues? Seriously?
If you want to buy a Blood game but you're not sure which one to choose, my suggestion would be: buy the original one. It's worth it, trust me.
Btw, there is a widescreen patch, make sure you get it.  Also you might want to get the Extra Crispy mod.
Every year (well almost) there's a Halloween MP event for this game, if you're interested head over to the Transfusion forums and ask around.

Must know: If you get poor performance, you need dgVoodoo.
Oh, and did I mention how much it crashes? Don't sneeze or the game will crash. SAVE often! (It even crashed during AGDQ 2018 haha)

"They just don't make them like they used to" - Caleb
My favorite level is C3L3: Temple of Poon. After C3L3 things start to get interesting (finally, after so many boring levels). I liked the Mad Scientist, he's funny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278275713', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1488561743}
review:
First of all, when Blood2 was released in 1998, it was one of my favorite shooter right away. It had a good gunplay, varied weapons and enemies, as well as a good level design. Overall, I had a lot of fun with it.

So why the negative rating?
Because the game is almost unplayable on a current PC with a current operating system. I tried every guide, but in the end the game always remained very unstable and crashes on average every 5 minutes.
Without a lot of mods / patches the game is not playable at all.

It is time for Steam to introduce a quality control to prevent games being offered at Steam that can not be played on current computers. Please Steam, do something against it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076042956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1487626305}
review:
There's quite a lot wrong with this game.

The writing sucks hard. It has all the finesse of something written by a 13 years old.
The level design is bland and feels incomplete. Definitely a step back from the original game.
The difficulty is not balanced properly. I played the game in the recommended difficulty, and kept finding myself running out of ammo. The enemies sometimes feel unfairly overpowered, for example one of the most basic enemy unit, a machinegun wielding soldier, can shoot you the first microsecond you enter their field of view, so it's realy hard not to take damage from them. To make matters worse, the game performs poorly on modern systems. I got it to run fairly smoothly and even at a reasonable resolution, but whenever there's dynamic lightning the framerate drops to the point that it's not pleasant to play.

Is there something good about this game? Not really. It feels like it could've used another 6 months of development. Unless you're a completionist, skip this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119731825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3985, 'last_played': 1480910277}
review:
A positive review because of that guy in the washing machine. :)

My opinion is: [b]IF[/b] you [b]LOVE[/b] the serie and [b]IF[/b] it is on sale, buy it.

This game is newer and uses newer graphics engine, but the ancient Blood I is still better IMHO. Moreover, there are some bugs present in that game from the very beginning (it is not the Steam version problem) that cause game crashes. I also have to redefine some keys every launch. If you encounter 1FPS problem, switch to software rendering engine or browse the community forum for tweaks.
On the other hand, I have no problems in launching the game under Windows 10 64-bit (Intel i7, Intel HD Graphics GPU + Nvidia GPU) and Steam always installs all game files correctly for me.

[i]DISCLAIMER: If you are 2000+ era and have never heard about the serie, you may simply don't get all the joy we got back then and better skip this title![/i]
But if you are [b]really[/b] interested in the serie, you may also check Blood I.

review:
I got it working in Windows 10. To set it up in high resolution I followed the directions here: http://steamcommunity.com/app/299050

To get it to run in Windows 10 I had to enable DirectPlay following these direction:

1. Right click Start
 2. Click Programs and Features
 3. Click Turn Windows features on or off
 4. Make sure there is a check in Legacy Components
 5. Click the + to expand
 6. Check the box for DirectPlay

The game runs great and now I can finally part with my old Windows 98 Laptop!!! For $2.49 you can't go wrong, but you will have to do some tweaking to get it to run in Windows 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994798873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1457735269}
review:
Great oldschool FPS game, similar a bit to Quake and Duke Nukem 3D. Environment is destructable, almost every item can be destroyed. The game itself is of course very bloody, has nice locations, interesting enemies and awesome dark atmosphere, occult-themed. It's pretty long and so freaking HARD - even on medium difficulty.
The game has many technical problems with modern hardware configurations and new operating systems, but yet they released it on steam without fix (damn you Atari). 
However, it's nothing you can't fix yourself by replacing some files.
Definitely worth playing :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198176008658', 'num_games_owned': 970, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1534575448}
review: Word to the wise: Don't enable any of the "Advanced" settings if you don't want this to crash. Run it on factory default and you're golden. That aside, this is one of those "so bad it's good" games. A bit of a repetative but catchy soundtrack, hammy one-liners you can't help but enjoy, and endless waves of fast-paced enemies if you're looking for good mindless killing fun and a great variety of both standard and occult-related weapons to help you do that. All in all, the game is dated and it shows, but it's still a lot of fun!
